SEARCH
Package msoe.swe2721.lab4_5

Class OrderManager

java.lang.Object
msoe.swe2721.lab4_5.OrderManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
OrderManagerInterface
public class OrderManager extends Object implements OrderManagerInterface
This class will keep track of orders. Orders can be put in and processed by this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderManager

      public OrderManager(CustomerManagerInterface cmi, InventoryManagerInterface imi) throws InvalidParameterException
      This is the constructor for the class. It takes in the instances of the customer manager and inventory manager that it is to interact with.
      Parameters:
      cmi - This is the default customer manager.
      imi - This is the default inventory manager.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - This exception will be thrown if either item is invalid / null.

  • Method Details

    • obtainOrderCount

      public int obtainOrderCount()
      This method will return the count of all orders that have been placed.
      Specified by:
      obtainOrderCount in interface OrderManagerInterface
      Returns:
      The count of all orders that have been placed will be returned.

    • obtainOrder

      public Order obtainOrder(int orderSequence) throws InvalidParameterException
      This will obtain the order from the system.
      Specified by:
      obtainOrder in interface OrderManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      orderSequence - This is the sequence number for the order. The first order that is placed is 1.
      Returns:
      The order will be returned.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - This will be thrown if the order sequence number is too large for the given system.

    • OrderItem

      public Order OrderItem(int customerID, int sku, int count) throws InvalidCustomerParameterException, InventoryOutOfStockException, InvalidSKUException
      This method will order an item for a given customer. The order will be returned, and it will also be placed on the master list within this class of orders that have been created.
      Specified by:
      OrderItem in interface OrderManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      customerID - This is the id of the customer.
      sku - This is the sku of the item that is to be ordered.
      count - This is the number of items that are to be ordered.
      Returns:
      The order object will be returned. The order will consist of the items that have been ordered - if there is enough in stock - or the number that can be supplied if there are not enough in stock to fulfill the entire order.
      Throws:
      InvalidCustomerParameterException - This will be thrown if the customer is not in the system or the ID is invalid.
      InventoryOutOfStockException - This exception will be thrown if there is no stock for the given item.
      InvalidSKUException - This will be thrown if the SKU itself is invalid or is not in the system.

    • OrderItem

      public Order OrderItem(String firstName, String lastName, int sku, int count) throws InvalidCustomerParameterException, InventoryOutOfStockException, InvalidSKUException
      This method will order an item for a given customer. The order will be returned, and it will also be placed on the master list within this class of orders that have been created.
      Specified by:
      OrderItem in interface OrderManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      firstName - This is the first name of the customer.
      lastName - This is the last name for the given customer.
      sku - This is the sku of the item that is to be ordered.
      count - This is the number of items that are to be ordered.
      Returns:
      The order object will be returned. The order will consist of the items that have been ordered - if there is enough in stock - or the number that can be supplied if there are not enough in stock to fulfill the entire order.
      Throws:
      InvalidCustomerParameterException - This will be thrown if the customer is not in the system or the ID is invalid.
      InventoryOutOfStockException - This exception will be thrown if there is no stock for the given item.
      InvalidSKUException - This will be thrown if the SKU itself is invalid or is not in the system.
